meanings.sent1: The old bridge looked untrusty, so we decided to take a different path.
meanings.sent2: She felt untrusty of the stranger offering her a ride.
meanings.sent3: The untrusty weather forecast predicted sunshine during a snowstorm.
meanings.sent4: His promises were as untrusty as a broken compass in a maze.
meanings.sent5: The untrusty floorboards creaked under their weight, causing unease.

meanings.definition: Not to be relied on or trusted.
meanings.sent1: The untrusty mechanic overcharged for unnecessary repairs.
meanings.sent2: The untrusty website had many pop-up ads and viruses.
meanings.sent3: The untrusty cat pretended to be stuck in a tree to get attention.
meanings.sent4: Her untrusty memory failed her during the important exam.
meanings.sent5: The untrusty alarm clock didn't go off, making her late for work.
